English.alert.about:
Run shortcuts automatically in the background according to a schedule of your choosing!

Cronios brings a UNIX-like cron scheduler to iOS. Shortcuts can be configured to run periodically at fixed times, dates or intervals.
English.alert.assistant.expression: This cron job will be evaluted according to the following cron schedule expression and explanation:
English.alert.cron.evaluation.title: Cronios Evaluation:
English.alert.cron.next: Cronios will run again in {{Time}} seconds.
English.alert.cron.start:
Cronios will begin checking the crontab every minute.

You can switch to another application on your iOS device, but do not stop this shortcut from running.

Stopping Cronios or running another shortcut will terminate cron job monitoring.
English.alert.cron.start.ipad:
Cronios will begin checking the crontab every minute.

You can switch to another application on your iOS device, but do not stop this shortcut from running. Cronios works best when running Split View mode on the iPad.

Stopping Cronios or running another shortcut will terminate cron job monitoring.
English.alert.croniosWatcher.clipboard:
To complete installation of the Cronios Watcher, follow these steps:

1. Create a new script in Scriptable called `Cronios Watcher` and paste in the contents of the clipboard.

2. Run the script in Scriptable to create a Siri Shortcut in Shortcuts.

3. Return to Cronios and tap Yes.
English.alert.croniosWatcher.clipboard.title: Cronios Watcher Script Copied to Clipboard
English.alert.docs.localization: Displaying Cronios documentation in English, since it is not available in {{Language}}. If you would like to help translate Cronios, please visit {{Localization URL}}.
English.alert.donate.thankyou: It's greatly appreciated. Keep on automating your iOS device and share Cronios with others!
English.alert.donate.thankyou.title: Thank you for supporting Cronios!
English.alert.expression.invalid: The cron schedule expression is invalid.
English.alert.expression.invalid.title: Invalid Cron Expression
English.alert.expression.valid: The cron schedule expression is valid.
English.alert.expression.valid.title: Valid Cron Schedule Expression
English.alert.keepAliveScriptable.off: You will no longer be notified when Cronios stops running.
English.alert.keepAliveScriptable.off.title: Cronios Watcher Disabled
English.alert.permissions:
Cronios requires the following permissions to be granted to the Shortcuts app:

‚Ä¢¬†Contacts ‚Ä¢
Used for generating menus in Cronios

‚Ä¢ Notifications ‚Ä¢
Banners that appear during normal operation of Cronios

If Cronios fails to open or has errors during operation, please grant Shortcuts permission to use these features in Settings > Privacy and Settings > Notifications.
English.alert.permissions.title: Permissions
English.alert.priority.invalid: A priority value must be between 1 and 100.
English.alert.priority.invalid.title: Invalid Priority
English.alert.shortcuts.retrieval: This may take a few moments.
English.alert.shortcuts.retrieval.title: Cronios: Retrieving a list of your shortcuts
English.alert.start: The first evaluation will occur in {{time}} seconds.
English.alert.testShortcut.offline: You are currently offline, so this shortcut will not run.
English.alert.testShortcut.offline.title: Offline
English.alert.update.none: You are currently running the latest version of Cronios.
English.alert.welcome:
Run Your Shortcuts on an Automatic Schedule!

Cronios brings a UNIX-like cron scheduler to iOS. Configure your shortcuts to run in the background at fixed times, dates, ranges, and intervals.
English.alert.welcome.title: Welcome to Cronios!
English.alert.whatsNew:
‚Ä¢ Cron Job Assistant guides you in creating new cron jobs.

‚Ä¢ Repeat Interval gives you more control over how often your cron job's shortcut runs

‚Ä¢ Refreshed interface matches that of GeoCuts and WatchCuts

‚Ä¢ Bug fixes and performance improvements

Learn more about these new features in Help.
English.alert.whatsNew.title: What's New in Cronios
English.error.assistant.expression.default: Using default schedule of any time.
English.error.assistant.hours: The ending hour cannot be before the starting hour.
English.error.assistant.hours.title: Invalid Hours
English.error.function.none: No method was sent to Cronios

English.error.import: There was an error importing the crontab. Please make sure that the file you're importing conforms to the Cronios crontab file format. Visit Help for more details.
English.error.import.title: Error Importing Crontab

English.error.multiple.items: Cannot edit multiple items at once.
English.error.offline: You must be connected to the internet for this feature to work.
English.error.offline.title: No Network Connection
English.error.repeatInterval: Repeat Interval value must be greater than 0
English.html.helper: The Cronios Daemon shortcut launches Cronios in `Run Continuously` mode with one tap from your iOS Home Screen or via Siri. After installing, go into the shortcut's options page and choose Add to Home Screen and Add to Siri.
English.label.dayOfWeek.names: 0 - Sunday,1 - Monday,2 - Tuesday,3 - Wednesday,4 - Thursday,5 - Friday,6 - Saturday
English.label.months.names: 1 - January,2 - February,3 - March,4 - April,5 - May,6 - June,7 - July,8 - August,9 - September,10 - October,11 - November,12 - December

English.prefs.notification.missing: A cron job has an error

English.prompt.assistant.activeSchedule:
Cron Job Assistant: Schedule (2/6)

The schedule determines how often Cronios will evaluate this cron job. Select the method to enter this cron job's schedule:

1. Use the Schedule Assistant (recommended)

2. Evaluate Every Minute

3. Use the Cron Expression Editor (advanced)

4. Manually input a cron expression (expert)

NOTE: You will set how often Cronios will run this cron job's shortcut in the Step 3.
English.prompt.assistant.dayOfMonth:
Schedule: Day of Month (2/6)

Do you want to evaluate this cron job every day in the month or on specific days?

NOTE: You will set how often Cronios will run this cron job's shortcut in the Step 3.
English.prompt.assistant.dayOfMonth.select: Select the days of the month to evaluate this cron job.
English.prompt.assistant.dayOfWeek: Select the days of the week to evaluate this cron job.
English.prompt.assistant.description:
Cron Job Assistant: Name (6/6)

Enter a name for this cron job.
English.prompt.assistant.hours:
Schedule: Hours (2/6)

Do you want to evaluate this cron job every hour, during a range of hours, or during specific hours?

NOTE: You will set how often Cronios will run this cron job's shortcut in the Step 3.
English.prompt.assistant.hours.select: Select the hours during which to evaluate this cron job.
English.prompt.assistant.minutes:
Schedule: Minutes (2/6)

Do you want to evaluate this cron job every minute, during a range of minutes, or at specific minutes?

NOTE: You will set how often Cronios will run this cron job's shortcut in the Step 3.
English.prompt.assistant.minutes.select: Select the minutes you want Cronios to evaluate this cron job.
English.prompt.assistant.month: Select the months in which to evaluate this cron job.
English.prompt.assistant.options:
Cron Job Assistant: Options (4/6)

Use the default options for this cron job or specify options?
English.prompt.assistant.options.select: Select the options for this cron job.
English.prompt.assistant.repeat:
Cron Job Assistant: Repeat Interval (3/6)

Choose the minimum amount of time a cron job must wait before Cronios will run its shortcut again.
English.prompt.assistant.search:
Cron Job Assistant: Shortcut (1/6)

Search for shortcuts by name. Separate search terms with new lines. Search strings are case-sensitive.

Leave blank to display all your shortcuts.
English.prompt.bulkEdit: Perform the following action on the selected cron jobs:
English.prompt.bulkEdit.select: Select cron jobs to bulk edit:
English.prompt.delete: Delete this cron job? This operation cannot be undone.
English.prompt.delete.multiple: Delete the selected cron jobs? This operation cannot be undone.
English.prompt.donate:
Have you been enjoying using Cronios to automate your iOS device?

Leaving a tip will help fund future development of Cronios and other shortcuts and applications.
English.prompt.editor.open: Cron schedule expression is invalid. Would you like to open it in the Cron Expression Editor?
English.prompt.entry.shortcut.none: No shortcut is assigned to this cron job.
English.prompt.entry.shortcut.title: The following shortcut will run:
English.prompt.erase.content:
Are you sure you want to delete all Cronios content and settings for this device?

This operation cannot be undone.
English.prompt.erase.content2:
Are you ABSOLUTELY SURE you want to delete all Cronios content and settings for this device?

This operation cannot be undone.
English.prompt.erase.logs:
Are you sure you want to delete all of Cronios logs for this device?

This operation cannot be undone.
English.prompt.import:
Import Crontab

Enter a valid Cronios crontab file to import cron jobs onto this device.
English.prompt.import.duplicate:
A cron job exists in your Crontab with the description `{{description}}` and shortcut `{{shortcut}}`.

Keep both, replace this cron job with the imported one, or skip?
English.prompt.import.external: You have imported cron jobs from an external application. Return to the application or go to Cronios Home?
English.prompt.import.select: Select cron jobs to import. Jobs marked ‚ùå are invalid and won't be imported.
English.prompt.keepAliveScriptable:
Get notified when Cronios stops running and relaunch Cronios in `Run Continuously` mode with one tap. This feature requires:

1. Cronios Daemon shortcut
2. Scriptable from the App Store
3. Cronios Watcher Scriptable script.

Confirm that you have installed all three items before enabling this feature.
English.prompt.keepAliveText: Enter the text that will be spoken quickly after each minute. Good words include 'beep', 'peep', and 'weep'.
English.prompt.new.cronjob:
New Cron Job

1. Set your schedule

2. Assign a shortcut

3. Save
English.prompt.priority:
Enter the priority for your cron job. Priority determines the order by which cron jobs are evaluated.

Leave blank for Normal priority.

Critical = 1-25

High = 25-50

Normal = 50

Low = 51-100
English.prompt.repeat:
Repeat Interval

Choose how often can this cron job run again after running
English.prompt.repeat.2:
Repeat Interval: Minutes

Enter the number of minutes that must pass before this cron job can run its shortcut again.
English.prompt.repeat.3:
Repeat Interval: Hours

Enter the number of hours that must pass before this cron job can run its shortcut again.
English.prompt.repeat.4:
Repeat Interval: Calendar Days

Enter the number of calendar days that must pass before this cron job can run its shortcut again.
English.prompt.reset: Reset Cronios settings or erase all content and settings for Cronios?
English.prompt.reset.settings:
Are you sure you want to reset Cronios settings on this device?

None of your cron jobs or logs will be affected.
English.prompt.shortcut.search:
Search for shortcuts by name.

Separate multiple search terms by new lines.

Exclude results by adding '-' in front of the keyword.
English.prompt.shortcut.select:
Select a shortcut to run with this cron job.

Note that not all shortcuts are optimized for running in the background. Check with the shortcut's developer if you encounter problems.
English.prompt.waitInterval: Choose an interval of time that Cronios will use to ping itself and try to stay awake.
English.test.dayOfMonth.label: dayOfMonth
English.test.dayOfWeek.label: dayOfWeek

English.test.hours.label: hours
English.test.instructions: Tap on a cron schedule expression component to edit.
English.test.match: A shortcut assigned to this cron expression would run on this date.
English.test.match.title: Cron expression matches date.
English.test.menu.every.label: Every
English.test.menu.range.label: By Range
English.test.menu.specific.label: With a Specific Value
